commit_message:
Add interop and endusers to OpenStack Mission

This resolution suggests the adoption of a slightly different
wording for the OpenStack Mission, to include interoperability
and end users needs.

Change-Id: I9fca919dad85a79af8ae0f94f46bdd3fb2026197

commit_message:
Refactor 4 opens as in Project team guide

The version of the "4 opens" that was in the wiki had been
refactored when copied to the Project Team Guide, to get
rid of the "we follow this principles" section which was
partially redundant and not really one of the "opens". Some
bits were moved to the corresponding sections, and redundant
text was removed.

Now that the wiki version has been imported in governance,
re-propose this same refactoring for inclusion in the reference
document.

Change-Id: I4da77173ce64b1e64106d48c7d9e3262dde561f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/27/264127/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The community controls the design process. You can help make this software meet your needs. The technical governance of the project is a community meritocracy with contributors electing technical leads and members of the Technical Committee. All project meetings are held in public IRC channels and recorded. Additional technical communication is through public mailing lists and is archived.
deleted_lines: We follow those principles: * **The community controls the design process.** You can help make this software meet your needs. * **The technical governance of the project is a community meritocracy** with contributors electing technical leads and members of the Technical Committee. * **This will always be truly free software.** We will never purposefully limit the functionality or scalability of the software to try and sell you an "enterprise" version * **All project meetings are held in public IRC channels and recorded.** * **Additional technical communication is through public mailing lists and is archived.**

commit_message:
Software config hook for configuring with Chef-Solo

Write an in-instance hook which allows chef-solo to be used for
provisioning software on instances using SoftwareConfig and
SoftwareDeployment resources.

Change-Id: Ia77c4d93f795f3983fa39044844b9ffdc345ab59
Closes-Bug: #1279062

commit_message:
EC2 API: make describe_instances() respect filters

Convert EC2 filters to Nova-style search_opts and pass them along.
This has the added benefit of no longer dropping the filters on the
floor when doing instance lookups.

Also, fix up the test data to resemble what actually comes in from
the EC2 API.

Closes-Bug: 922835
Change-Id: Icef3f86befc96e325263dd26a7cdfe587e2d6a47

commit_message:
Fix broken filtering by tags in v3

The code rearranges lines to enable filtering by tags.
Example:
/withprops/v1.0/drafts?tag=cicici&tag=hyhyhy

Closes-Bug: 1489126

Change-Id: Ib2a2cd3340ff52b188b3b7c7c75e20a5c8803e45

added_lines: tags = [] while 'tag' in params: tags.append(params.pop('tag').strip()) if tags: query_params['filters']['tags'] = {'value': tags}

subject: Code refactoring for couchdb
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-05 21:46:26.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/common/operating_system.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/couchdb/service.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_dbaas.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_operating_system.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/couchdb/system.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/afb80fafcaf7533a6ab524e8641f64720a24d001', 'message': 'Code refactoring for couchdb

The code in the change_permissions function for couchdb in service.py was
refactored. In addition, translation was added to several RuntimeError messages
that were missing the underscore for translation. Replaced shell calls with the
respective operating_system service commands - start/stop/ enable/disable/
change permissions and modified tests as necessary. Created operating_system
service command change_user_group and associated tests.

Change-Id: Ia193afa5a144dce247d621d14f84c9f066ab4c6a
'}]
commit_message:
Code refactoring for couchdb

The code in the change_permissions function for couchdb in service.py was
refactored. In addition, translation was added to several RuntimeError messages
that were missing the underscore for translation. Replaced shell calls with the
respective operating_system service commands - start/stop/ enable/disable/
change permissions and modified tests as necessary. Created operating_system
service command change_user_group and associated tests.

Change-Id: Ia193afa5a144dce247d621d14f84c9f066ab4c6a

subject: Fix ordering of check in yum_Install, so PIPESTATUS[0] is checked first
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-12 19:18:58.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/85ed5aac9c81f7ea86a89e1ab691a448041f01eb', 'message': "Fix ordering of check in yum_Install, so PIPESTATUS[0] is checked first

Re-ordered check for how yum_install went, so PIPESTATUS[0] is the value
of the awk command. Failure in doing so renders the check to be after
the if statement, which gives it the value of 1.

This issue apperas to have been introduced in commit 2babf396

${PIPESTATUS[0]} != 0

...
Running transaction check
Running transaction test
Transaction test succeeded
Running transaction
  Installing : epel-release-7-5.noarch                                      1/1
  Verifying  : epel-release-7-5.noarch                                      1/1

Installed:
  epel-release.noarch 0:7-5

Complete!
+ result=0
+ '[' 0 '!=' 0 ']'   <== result
+ [[ 1 != 0 ]]       <== ${PIPESTATUS[0]}, used one statement too late
+ echo 1344 'yum install failure'
1344 yum install failure
+ result=1
+ return 1
+ die 286 'Error installing EPEL repo, cannot continue'
+ local exitcode=1

Reference-Change-Id: Ia33bb98f47017f6ec00eb3b7261ed42d72efc573
Change-Id: I801100134754454f902cfe9034021837b1a185dc
Closes-Bug: #1522590
Signed-off-by: Flavio Fernandes <ffernand@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ordering of check in yum_Install, so PIPESTATUS[0] is checked first

Re-ordered check for how yum_install went, so PIPESTATUS[0] is the value
of the awk command. Failure in doing so renders the check to be after
the if statement, which gives it the value of 1.

This issue apperas to have been introduced in commit 2babf396

${PIPESTATUS[0]} != 0

...
Running transaction check
Running transaction test
Transaction test succeeded
Running transaction
  Installing : epel-release-7-5.noarch                                      1/1
  Verifying  : epel-release-7-5.noarch                                      1/1

Installed:
  epel-release.noarch 0:7-5

Complete!
+ result=0
+ '[' 0 '!=' 0 ']'   <== result
+ [[ 1 != 0 ]]       <== ${PIPESTATUS[0]}, used one statement too late
+ echo 1344 'yum install failure'
1344 yum install failure
+ result=1
+ return 1
+ die 286 'Error installing EPEL repo, cannot continue'
+ local exitcode=1

Reference-Change-Id: Ia33bb98f47017f6ec00eb3b7261ed42d72efc573
Change-Id: I801100134754454f902cfe9034021837b1a185dc
Closes-Bug: #1522590
Signed-off-by: Flavio Fernandes <ffernand@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/37/266537/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ ${PIPESTATUS[0]} != 0 ]]; then elif [ $result != 0 ]; then echo $LINENO "Missing packages detected"
deleted_lines: if [ $result != 0 ]; then echo $LINENO "Missing packages detected" elif [[ ${PIPESTATUS[0]} != 0 ]]; then

commit_message:
Code refactoring for couchdb

The code in the change_permissions function for couchdb in service.py was
refactored. In addition, translation was added to several RuntimeError messages
that were missing the underscore for translation. Replaced shell calls with the
respective operating_system service commands - start/stop/ enable/disable/
change permissions and modified tests as necessary. Created operating_system
service command change_user_group and associated tests.

Change-Id: I9605ea30d3b8e5ced532394bbdbccd6ac3747721
Closes-Bug: #1481979
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/70/210170/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for dir in [COUCHDB_LIB_DIR, COUCHDB_LOG_DIR, COUCHDB_BIN_DIR, COUCHDB_CONFIG_DIR]: operating_system.chown(dir, 'couchdb', 'couchdb', as_root=True) operating_system.chmod(dir, FileMode.ADD_GRP_RW, as_root=True) raise RuntimeError(_( "Command to disable CouchDB server on boot not found.")) raise RuntimeError(_( "Command to disable CouchDB server on boot not found.")) raise RuntimeError(_("Command to start CouchDB server not found.")) raise RuntimeError(_("Could not start CouchDB server."))
deleted_lines: operating_system.chown( COUCHDB_LIB_DIR, 'couchdb', 'couchdb', as_root=True ) operating_system.chown( COUCHDB_LOG_DIR, 'couchdb', 'couchdb', as_root=True ) operating_system.chown( COUCHDB_BIN_DIR, 'couchdb', 'couchdb', as_root=True ) operating_system.chown( COUCHDB_CONFIG_DIR, 'couchdb', 'couchdb', as_root=True ) operating_system.chmod(COUCHDB_LIB_DIR, FileMode.ADD_GRP_RW, as_root=True) operating_system.chmod(COUCHDB_LOG_DIR, FileMode.ADD_GRP_RW, as_root=True) operating_system.chmod(COUCHDB_BIN_DIR, FileMode.ADD_GRP_RW, as_root=True) operating_system.chmod(COUCHDB_CONFIG_DIR, FileMode.ADD_GRP_RW, as_root=True) raise RuntimeError( "Command to disable CouchDB server on boot not found.") raise RuntimeError( "Command to disable CouchDB server on boot not found.") raise RuntimeError("Command to start CouchDB server not found.") raise RuntimeError("Could not start CouchDB server.")

commit_message:
Improvements in condition checking code

In condition code for example, if/while len: is
same as if/while len > 0: . so in this patch I modified the
condition checking code

Change-Id: I3230d99315fbaf6e518394bc8c96f9f309ed5ff7

commit_message:
Add NetApp FlashRay/Mars driver

This commit adds a new driver for the NetApp FlashRay storage
controller running the Mars operating system. The supported
protocol is FibreChannel. The new driver includes the minimum
set of features required by Mitaka release plus a few more
such as manage/unmanage, consistency groups, and retype.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint netapp-flashray-driver
Change-Id: Ie424fba7b5d08f9918745b082b31686d9eed4a41

commit_message:
FIX: provider_networks module for  multiple vlans

Updated the provider networks library to process multiple ranges.
The patch simply moves the vlan process stanza to ensure any network
with a vlan range is processed correctly.

Change-Id: Ifaa9c7eb8432644b95052cd2e48c1bbc5cd0e0b7
Co-Authored-By: Aaron Segura <aaron.segura@RACKSPACE.COM>
Closes-Bug: #1522149
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit dc30a8516d0977c1b13b950c22c605e5bfde5b66)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/97/257797/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for vlan_range in net['network']['range'].split(','): self.network_vlan_ranges.append( '%s:%s' % ( net['network']['net_name'], vlan_range.strip() )
deleted_lines: for vlan_range in net['network']['range'].split(','): self.network_vlan_ranges.append( '%s:%s' % ( net['network']['net_name'], vlan_range.strip() )

commit_message:
Skip Keystone task when not using swift w keystone

It's possible to remove keystoneauth from the middleware pipeline,
but the play will fail because the keystone swift User/roles/perms
tasks will not be able to succeed.

This patch skips those tasks when not using keystoneauth in the
middleware pipeline.

Change-Id: I87143b5c220dc312e2cb5d7e3dd3e9e01609ff91
Closes-Bug: #1523581
(cherry picked from commit 5dec08a9820cfb085d1db1a5f9c940b81d5dcbbc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/34/263734/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: when: - inventory_hostname == groups['swift_all'][0] - '"keystoneauth" in swift_middleware_list'

commit_message:
Change LOG.warn to LOG.warning

Python 3 deprecated the logger.warn method, see:
https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
so we prefer to use warning to avoid DeprecationWarning.

Change-Id: I9a99477f3f41884e86c984ffde9f46498953e933
Closes-Bug: #1530742
(cherry picked from commit c92954ee9d3ccc28e94c0d824bf6ec0e34e56916)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/99/264099/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.warning("There are no l3 agents alive we could " "migrate routers onto.") LOG.warning("Would like to migrate router=%s to agent=%s", router_id, target_id)
deleted_lines: LOG.warn("There are no l3 agents alive we could " "migrate routers onto.") LOG.warn("Would like to migrate router=%s to agent=%s", router_id, target_id)

subject: Enable multipath usage on all OpenStack hosts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-14 15:08:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/5fb94c45fc1b96497d4f9b46320f1af2aefae2ab', 'message': 'Adding multipath-tools package for nova hosts

This fix adds the multipath-tools package to all nova
nodes in order to support iscsi-multipath inside nova.
Additionally when using multipath, the stock AIO limit
per process is to low and needs to be increased to at
least 128k.
This fix will also increase the fs.aio-max-nr to 128k

In order to enable this feature in nova the following override
needs to be configured:

nova_nova_conf_overrides:
  libvirt:
      iscsi_use_multipath: true

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1524957

Change-Id: Iff6a6474baac474ccc9e32dac75c9677f5fee089
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-14 15:53:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/d8106f33982bbc7a1df45460e8ceb5ea7464f0e6', 'message': 'Adding multipath-tools package for nova hosts

This fix adds the multipath-tools package to all nova
nodes in order to support iscsi-multipath inside nova.
Additionally when using multipath, the stock AIO limit
per process is to low and needs to be increased to at
least 128k.
This fix will also increase the fs.aio-max-nr to 128k

In order to enable this feature in nova the following override
needs to be configured:

nova_nova_conf_overrides:
  libvirt:
      iscsi_use_multipath: true

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1524957

Change-Id: I36da282043ce864c8a1fb69a1ee02e3a273c14e4
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-16 09:21:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/315da8248314c1eb414abc6b56a63a19cf098054', 'message': 'Enable multipath usage on all OpenStack hosts

This fix adds the multipath-tools package to all nova
nodes in order to support iscsi-multipath inside nova.
Additionally when using multipath, the stock AIO limit
per process (fs.aio-max-nr) is too low and needs to be
increased to at least 128k.

In order to enable this feature in nova the following override
needs to be configured:

nova_nova_conf_overrides:
  libvirt:
      iscsi_use_multipath: true

This is a backport combining two patches:
 - https://review.openstack.org/256082
 - https://review.openstack.org/257104

commit_message:
Enable multipath usage on all OpenStack hosts

This fix adds the multipath-tools package to all nova
nodes in order to support iscsi-multipath inside nova.
Additionally when using multipath, the stock AIO limit
per process (fs.aio-max-nr) is too low and needs to be
increased to at least 128k.

In order to enable this feature in nova the following override
needs to be configured:

nova_nova_conf_overrides:
  libvirt:
      iscsi_use_multipath: true

This is a backport combining two patches:
 - https://review.openstack.org/256082
 - https://review.openstack.org/257104

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1524957
Change-Id: I36da282043ce864c8a1fb69a1ee02e3a273c14e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/25/257425/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - multipath-tools

commit_message:
Gate: Bootstrap Host with updated CPU Map

The different cloud providers for OpenStack-CI sometimes make use of
hardware which libvirt does not appropriately map. This results in
gate check failures as the nova scheduler is unable to find a
suitable host on which to build the test VM's.

This patch implements an extra set of tasks into the bootstrap
process which adjusts the libvirt cpu map to resolve this issue.

Implements: blueprint gate-split
Change-Id: I666f53e01066bf8bff4d28fa012eadae7c958116
(cherry picked from commit fe9878c228514f3e7739f04aec34d0bb16372edf)

once no more jobs are configured to use Fedora 21 and we have cleaned up
our Fedora 21 images/nodes from nodepool.

commit_message:
Enable consisgroups in SolidFire driver

This patch enables Consistency Group support in the SolidFire driver.
SolidFire group snapshots are what is used to provide consistent
snapshots on the backend.

A variety of helpers were used to wrap the API requests, meanwhile
other helpers were utilized to jump through the necessary hoops to
adopt the SolidFire API/group snapshots for use in consistency groups.
Because the SolidFire array does not create logical groupings of
volumes as consistency groups, there are a lot of no-ops used to
satisfy the necessary Cinder functions as specified in driver.py.
In-line comments attempt to clarify this. In short, a lot of searching
is needed to create consistency groups on the fly per request.

Change-Id: I82a8b2b6f2db4fca0c1cac892e323eae59c6b98c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/38/259638/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add ceilometer messaging_url for each service...
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-05 15:38:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/3cd191bf2bafef127094b67314609cb736cd30bc', 'message': "Add ceilometer messaging_url for each service...

Without specifying messaging_urls, ceilometer only listens on the vhost
specified in the rabbit configuration directives.
To align with the the default OSA architecture, which isolates each service
into it's own respective rabbitmq vhost, this patchset has added jinja code
in the ceilometer.conf.j2 template to specifiy a messaging_url for each service,
 and for each service, each rabbitmq host. This ensures ceilometer is spawning
the correct number of listeners on the correct vhost and consuming notifications
correctly.

In addition, a few small changes were made in the patch set:

* store_events is now True by default
* event_definitions has been truncated to match the one in ceilometer's master branch
* rabbitmq_userid and rabbitmq_vhost service variables have been moved to group_vars.

Change-Id: I2bd9cf0ac7ca0492f6b2c56897f77117d2ae730b
Closes-Bug: #1526457

commit_message:
Add ceilometer messaging_url for each service...

Without specifying messaging_urls, ceilometer only listens on the vhost
specified in the rabbit configuration directives.
To align with the the default OSA architecture, which isolates each service
into it's own respective rabbitmq vhost, this patchset has added jinja code
in the ceilometer.conf.j2 template to specifiy a messaging_url for each service,
 and for each service, each rabbitmq host. This ensures ceilometer is spawning
the correct number of listeners on the correct vhost and consuming notifications
correctly.

In addition, a few small changes were made in the patch set:

* store_events is now True by default
* rabbitmq_userid and rabbitmq_vhost service variables have been moved to group_vars.

Change-Id: I2bd9cf0ac7ca0492f6b2c56897f77117d2ae730b
Depends-On: I98bcd17dac9a47cc19e0d9ec90176945a6d7e355
Closes-Bug: #1526457

commit_message:
Remove unused openstack-ansible-role-requirements.py script

This patch removes an unused script which performed actions that
ansible-galaxy could not previously perform, but now can. The
associated requirements.txt entries are also removed.

This patch is different from the master patch in that it also
includes the removal of the use of this script which was
implemented in Change If7f83d0875a5b074f506235d650be48a6e461e56

Change-Id: Ice29a8ba255b60870fd42ab51af93f2d683b22ca
(cherry picked from commit f6d7c1fa352a345c6cf45b3fe5fb04552d17dbc7)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/06/265706/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python # Copyright 2014, Rackspace US, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. # # (c) 2014, Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com> import json import os import requests import yaml from cloudlib import arguments def _arguments(): """Return CLI arguments.""" arguments_dict = { 'shared_args': { 'filter': { 'commands': [ '--filter' ], 'help': 'filter the git api repo returns to the string' ' type that begins with the string provided.' ' Filtering is ONLY ever used with pulling' ' from the upstream github API.' ' Default: %(default)s', 'metavar': '[STR]', 'default': 'openstack_role-' } }, 'optional_args': { 'requirement_file': { 'commands': [ '--requirement-file' ], 'help': 'Path to a dictionary file. The file should contain' ' one word per line. Default: %(default)s', 'metavar': '[PATH]', 'default': os.path.join( os.getcwd(), 'ansible-role-requirements.yml' ) }, 'repo': { 'commands': [ '--repo' ], 'help': 'Full path the git repo api path that the script will' ' scan through.', 'metavar': '[URL]', 'default': 'https://api.github.com/orgs/os-cloud/repos' }, 'git_username': { 'commands': [ '-u', '--git-username' ], 'help': 'Username for a github account.', 'metavar': '[STR]', 'default': None }, 'git_password': { 'commands': [ '-p', '--git-password' ], 'help': 'Passowrd for a github account.', 'metavar': '[STR]', 'default': None } }, 'subparsed_args': { 'update': { 'help': 'Run an update on an existing inventory. This will' ' attempt to update all of your role, that have a' ' defined `github_api` key to the latest tag. If a tag' ' is not available the default branch will be used.', 'shared_args': ['filter'] }, 'create': { 'help': 'Create a new ansible requirements file based on the' ' discovered repositories using a defined filter on' ' the repo name.', 'shared_args': ['filter'] } } } return arguments.ArgumentParserator( arguments_dict=arguments_dict, epilog='Licensed Apache2', title='Create/Update an ansible galaxy repository file', detail='Ansible Galaxy repository generator that will parse an' ' existing requirements file and update it the latest stable' ' release or create a new one if one was not passed into the' ' generator or discovered.', description='Generate an ansible galaxy requirements file.', env_name='OpenStack' ).arg_parser() def process_request(url, auth): """Perform an http request. :param url: full url to query :type url: ``str`` :param auth: username, password credentials :type auth: ``tuple`` || ``None`` :returns: ``dict`` """ content = requests.get(url, auth=auth) if content.status_code >= 300: raise SystemExit(content.content) return content.json() def _get_repos(repo_access, auth): """Return a list of repositories from the provided github api. :param repo_access: requests head object. :type repo_access: ``str`` :param auth: username, password credentials :type auth: ``tuple`` || ``None`` :return: ``list`` """ if 'link' in repo_access.__dict__: repo_content = list() links = repo_access.__dict__['link'].split(',') pages = [i.replace(' ', '') for i in links if 'last' in i] page_link = pages[0].split(';')[0] page_link = page_link.strip('>').strip('<') page_link = page_link.split('=') for page in range(0, int(page_link[-1])): page_number = page + 1 content = requests.get( '%s=%s' % (page_link, page_number), auth=auth ) for repo in content.json(): repo_content.append(repo) else: return json.loads(repo_content) else: return process_request(url=repo_access.__dict__['url'], auth=auth) def get_repos(url, auth=None): """Return json from a request URL. This method assumes that you are hitting the github API. :param url: Full url to the git api user / org / or repo. :type url: ``str`` :param auth: username, password credentials :type auth: ``tuple`` || ``None`` :returns: ``dict`` """ return _get_repos( repo_access=requests.head(url, auth=auth), auth=auth ) def process_tags(git_repo, repo, auth): """Itentify and set the highest tag from a git repo. :param git_repo: github repo item :type git_repo: ``dict`` :param repo: anisble repo manifest item :type repo: ``dict`` :param auth: username, password credentials :type auth: ``tuple`` || ``None`` """ try: tags = process_request(url=git_repo['tags_url'], auth=auth) if tags: latest_release = max([i['name'] for i in tags]) else: latest_release = git_repo['default_branch'] except (IndexError, KeyError): repo['version'] = git_repo['default_branch'] else: repo['version'] = latest_release def create_from_github_repos(args, auth): """Return a list of dicts used for creating an ansible role manifest. :param args: user defined arguments :type args: ``dict`` :param auth: username, password credentials :type auth: ``tuple`` || ``None`` :return: ``list`` """ requirements = list() filter_name = args['filter'] for repo in get_repos(url=args['repo'], auth=auth): if filter_name and not repo['name'].startswith(filter_name): continue print('* Repo created: [ %s ]' % repo['name']) item = dict() item['src'] = repo['html_url'] item['name'] = repo['name'].split('-')[-1] item['github_api'] = repo['url'] process_tags(git_repo=repo, repo=item, auth=auth) requirements.append(item) else: return requirements def update_existing_repos(repos, auth): """Update existing repos for new tags. For this method to work the entry in the manifest must have an entry for ``github_api``. If this item is not found, the repo entry will be skipped. :param repos: list of items in an existing manifest. :type repos: ``list`` :param auth: username, password credentials :type auth: ``tuple`` || ``None`` :return: """ for repo in repos: github_api = repo.get('github_api') if github_api: print('* Repo checking for update: [ %s ]' % repo['name']) git_repo = process_request(url=github_api, auth=auth) process_tags(git_repo=git_repo, repo=repo, auth=auth) else: return repos def requirements_file(args): requirement_file = os.path.abspath( os.path.expanduser( args['requirement_file'] ) ) if not os.path.isdir(os.path.dirname(requirement_file)): os.makedirs(os.path.dirname(requirement_file)) return requirement_file def build_requirements(args): args['requirement_file'] = requirements_file(args) if args['git_username']: _auth = (args['git_username'], args['git_password']) else: _auth = None if args['parsed_command'] == 'create': requirements = create_from_github_repos(args=args, auth=_auth) elif args['parsed_command'] == 'update': if os.path.isfile(args['requirement_file']): with open(args['requirement_file'], 'rb') as f: requirements = update_existing_repos( repos=yaml.safe_load(f.read()), auth=_auth ) else: requirements = create_from_github_repos(args=args, auth=_auth) else: raise SystemExit( '"parsed_command: %s" not found.' % args['parsed_command'] ) with open(args['requirement_file'], 'wb') as f: f.write( yaml.safe_dump( sorted(requirements, key=lambda k: k['name']), default_flow_style=False, width=1000 ) ) print('File Ready: [ %s ]' % args['requirement_file']) def main(): user_args = _arguments() build_requirements(args=user_args) if __name__ == '__main__': main()

commit_message:
Set --serial as default in run-tempest.sh

Currently this is set in gate-check-commit, but this is a sensible
default for situations other than gate-check-commit so it should be set
in run-tempest itself.

Change-Id: I0bef1c5650757d54dd4fbeb6b872bd00cabed627
Closes-bug: #1530796
(cherry picked from commit 850221910e780f6d0b3d790b377992ca6b329456)

The .yml extension is missing from the galera-install playbook
name in the documented command for recovering galera.

commit_message:
Skip Keystone task when not using swift w keystone

It's possible to remove keystoneauth from the middleware pipeline,
but the play will fail because the keystone swift User/roles/perms
tasks will not be able to succeed.

This patch skips those tasks when not using keystoneauth in the
middleware pipeline.

Change-Id: I87143b5c220dc312e2cb5d7e3dd3e9e01609ff91
Closes-Bug: #1523581
(cherry picked from commit 5dec08a9820cfb085d1db1a5f9c940b81d5dcbbc)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/35/263735/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: when: - inventory_hostname == groups['swift_all'][0] - '"keystoneauth" in swift_middleware_list'

commit_message:
Include extra conf file updates when updating SHA's

This patch updates the sources-branch-updater convenience script to
make it also check for additional updates relating to policy.json,
paste.ini, rootwrap.conf, rootwrap filters, etc.

This ensures that the SHA updates are more complete and the updates
require less effort to do.

In addition to the script update there are some changes to other
file names and locations in order to facilitate the file's ability
to do everything correctly. The changes enforce a specific convention
for the names and locations of files it manages.

Conflicts:
>------playbooks/roles/os_aodh/tasks/aodh_post_install.yml
>------playbooks/roles/os_aodh/templates/policy.json.j2

Change-Id: I99899e61e0527639abc8b3bae0296a891607a31d
(cherry picked from commit 7ef2a9e48fc471ef142ab98acecc92d27f1ec3c4)

subject: Opendaylight driver refactor to handle out of sync issues
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-10 23:38:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl/commit/79619813cece249b7ff3bd0b1383dfefb7e30751', 'message': 'Opendaylight driver refactor to handle out of sync issues

This commits refactors the Opendaylight ML2 mechanism driver to
handle race conditions and out of sync issues. It attempts to
address these using an atomic thread synchronization model that
tracks the sync, retry, success and failed states of Neutron objects
sent to Opendaylight.

Partially fixes Bug # 1493551

commit_message:
Opendaylight driver refactor to handle out of sync issues

This commits refactors the Opendaylight ML2 mechanism driver to
handle race conditions and out of sync issues. It attempts to
address these using an atomic thread synchronization model that
tracks the sync, retry, success and failed states of Neutron objects
sent to Opendaylight.

Partial-Bug #1493551

Co-Authored-By: Arvind Somya (asomya@cisco.com)
Co-Authored-By: Rich Curran (rcurran@cisco.com)

Change-Id: I654321a9012aba98775690d530e3e0788957b21b

commit_message:
devstack: use odl lithium snapshot 0.3.3 instead of 0.3.1

This patch make CI gate use lithium snapshot 0.3.3 instead of 0.3.1.
This is also preparation for adding gate with beryllium snapshot.

Change-Id: Ida9015812568b923ede23272bf36e4784b1d43e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/36/265436/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # for compatibility before updating # project-config/jenkins/jobs/networking-odl.yaml ODL_RELEASE=${ODL_RELEASE:-lithium-snapshot-0.3.3} if [[ "$ODL_RELEASE_BASE" == "beryllium-snapshot" ]]; then ODL_RELEASE=beryllium-snapshot-0.4.0 elif [[ "$ODL_RELEASE_BASE" == "lithium-snapshot" ]]; then ODL_RELEASE=lithium-snapshot-0.3.3 fi ODL_RELEASE=${ODL_RELEASE}

subject: devstack: make odl logging friendly for gate job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-07 00:54:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl/commit/6a7744a9bd1fa441801ecac875985b81f133cbfa', 'message': "devstack: make odl logging friendly for gate job

ODL logs are lost by log rotation which makes it difficult/impossible
to know how ODL behaved. And gate job fails to compress the log file of ODL.
With this patch, log rotation is effectively disabled and the log file of
ODL is now compressed by gate job.

The patch changes configurations related to logging of ODL.
- Honor config variable, LOGDIR, when determining file name for log
- Disable log rotation by setting max file size to large enough
  so that log won't be lost.
  gate job doesn't know about file name of xxx.log.<N>, so it fails to
  compress them.

Closes-Bug: #1531673
Change-Id: I240bb99570e5afaaf75dce6b0fb055b74cf237e6

commit_message:
devstack: make odl logging friendly for gate job

ODL logs are lost by log rotation which makes it difficult/impossible
to know how ODL behaved. And gate job fails to compress the log file of ODL.
With this patch, log rotation is effectively disabled and the log file of
ODL is now compressed by gate job.

The patch changes configurations related to logging of ODL.
- Honor config variables, DEST, LOGDIR, SCREEN_LOGDIR, when
  determining file name for log
- Disable log rotation by setting max file size to large enough
  so that log won't be lost.
  gate job doesn't know about file name of xxx.log.<N>, so it fails to
  compress them.

Closes-Bug: #1531673
Change-Id: I240bb99570e5afaaf75dce6b0fb055b74cf237e6

commit_message:
Skeleton for User Guide

Initial empty framework to fill in.

Following up on the discussion at the Tokyo Summit, we are
putting together a User Guide for Magnum.  The initial list of
sections is from the brainstorming session, organized into a
particular sequence that seems reasonable, but this can be
reorganized and extended as the team sees fit.

The intention is to allow contributors to work on all
sections in parallel.

Partially implements: blueprint user-guide
Change-Id: I17ba09f833581bd7fcae9c8a328fc89140b704d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/99/263599/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ================= Magnum User Guide ================= This guide is intended for users who use Magnum to deploy and manage clusters of hosts for a Container Orchestration Engine. It describes the infrastructure that Magnum creates and how to work with them. Section 1-3 describe Magnum itself, including an overview, the CLI and Horizon interface. Section 4-8 describe the Container Orchestration Engine's supported, along with a guide on how to select one that best meets your needs. Section 9-15 describe the low level OpenStack infrastructure that is created and managed by Magnum to support the Container Orchestration Engine's. ======== Contents ======== #. `Overview`_ #. `Python Client`_ #. `Horizon Interface`_ #. `Choosing COE`_ #. `Native clients`_ #. `Kubernetes`_ #. `Swarm`_ #. `Mesos`_ #. `Transport Layer Security`_ #. `Networking`_ #. `High Availability`_ #. `Scaling`_ #. `Storage`_ #. `Image Management`_ #. `Bay resources`_ =========== Terminology =========== ======== Overview ======== *To be filled in* Magnum rationale, compelling features ============= Python Client ============= *To be filled in* ================= Horizon Interface ================= *To be filled in with screenshots* ============ Choosing COE ============ *To be filled in* Buyer's guide with example use case, can use this as model: http://www.openstack.org/software/project-navigator ============== Native clients ============== *To be filled in* ========== Kubernetes ========== *To be filled in* ===== Swarm ===== *To be filled in* ===== Mesos ===== *To be filled in* ======================== Transport Layer Security ======================== *To be filled in* Native Client Configuration guide for each COE ========== Networking ========== *To be filled in* ================= High Availability ================= *To be filled in* ======= Scaling ======= *To be filled in* Include Autoscaling ======= Storage ======= *To be filled in* ================ Image Management ================ *To be filled in* ============= Bay Resources ============= *To be filled in*

commit_message:
mech_driver: factor out of resource filter-out logic

This patch is a follow up patch to the change set of
be5129e50562b195778385bbf4023ddbec63ef5e,
change id of I2c7e699c227f1fa3251861a2698410666f767701
This patch addresses the comment at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/225191/
for refactor out of filtering and code clean up.

Change-Id: I9e025c9aad71d21d5aaeaea97e9cb70b40682125

added_lines: #!/bin/bash # # Copyright 2015 Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. # # Export env variables . ./ora_env.sh PID=`echo $$` sql_file="$ORACLE_USER_HOME/pdb_create_$PID.sql" # Create pluggable database # Open the pluggable database for read-write cat > $sql_file << EOF CONNECT / as sysdba; SET LINESIZE 100; SET PAGESIZE 50; CREATE PLUGGABLE DATABASE $1 ADMIN USER $ADMIN_USER IDENTIFIED BY $ADMIN_PWD roles=(CONNECT,DBA) FILE_NAME_CONVERT = ('$PDBSEED', '$ORADATA/$1'); ALTER PLUGGABLE DATABASE $1 OPEN; EXIT; EOF chown oracle:oracle $sql_file # Execute the sql statements su - oracle -c ". ~/ora_env.sh && sqlplus /nolog @$sql_file $1" # remove the sql_file rm -f $sql_file

commit_message:
Replace library function os.popen() with subprocess

os.popen() is deprecated since python 2.6. Resolved with use of
subprocess module.

Change-Id: I731d2a949513e0ab2c5514d34b2301dedea26cca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/40/266240/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <<<<<<< HEAD======= git_cmd = ["git", "log", "--pretty=format:'%ad, commit %h'", "--date=local", "-n1"] html_last_updated_fmt = subprocess.Popen(git_cmd, stdout=subprocess.PIPE).\ communicate()[0] >>>>>>> add66b9... Replace library function os.popen() with subprocess

commit_message:
Avoid initializing WMI connections on Linux

Nova unit tests are failing due to a WMI connection
initialization on Linux. WMI is a Windows specific
module.

Change-Id: I67bf08517707e992f45045511350a884faf260f2
Closes-Bug: #1533290

added_lines: if sys.platform == "win32": self._smb_conn = wmi.WMI(moniker=r"root\Microsoft\Windows\SMB")

commit_message:
Enable Cassandra Database

Allow Cassandra Database to be used as backend database.

100% backward compatible with Influxdb.

Should not require any install or config changes to
use the default Influxdb.

Change-Id: I4cfe50a99eea0f8ae7421dcefbdd2cb2cc008b3b

commit_message:
Update admin auth data for devstack

Our gate need the proper admin auth data set up in the proper configs. In this case the neutron.conf
Update neutron.conf with the admin data so gates can pass.

Change-Id: Iac87674ca94bcabc3047c9a3679e1385cf1c8d63

commit_message:
Swift store: do not send a 0 byte chunk

When a chunk of size 0 is added, it is immediately deleted. Swift might try to
delete it before its creation is complete, though, leading to a race condition.
Not sending this 0 byte chunk soves this issue.

Co-Authored-By: Stuart McLaren <stuart.mclaren@hp.com>
Change-Id: I2179a1e6e27a636bfca448fa18481eb11e64e6da
Closes-Bug: #1518431

Adds OSSA-2016-002 (CVE-2015-8749)

Change-Id: I0ec105bd69ce7929b6cf10006e7b10e5d91782d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ossa refs/changes/52/265952/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: date: 2016-01-11 id: OSSA-2016-002 title: 'Xen connection password leak in logs via StorageError' description: 'Matt Riedemann from IBM reported an information disclosure vulnerability in Nova. If a StorageError occurs when attempting to connect a volume using the Xen API, the connection parameters will be logged. These parameters may include credentials that are not masked. An attacker with read access to Nova logs could use these credentials with the Xen API directly. Only Nova deployments using the Xen backend are affected by this flaw.' affected-products: - product: nova version: ">=2014.2 <= 2015.1.2, == 12.0.0" vulnerabilities: - cve-id: CVE-2015-8749 reporters: - name: 'Matt Riedemann' affiliation: IBM reported: - CVE-2015-8749 issues: links: - https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1516765 type: launchpad reviews: mitaka: - https://review.openstack.org/245987 liberty: - https://review.openstack.org/247825 kilo: - https://review.openstack.org/249239 type: gerrit notes: - 'This fix will be included in future 2015.1.3 (kilo) and 12.0.1 (liberty) releases.'

remove python 2.6 trove classifier

remove the trove classifier implying that this project supports 2.6.

commit_message:
Sahara Integration

Integration of OpenStack data processing service (sahara) with
TripleO.

- Deploys sahara in distributed mode (separate api and engine
  processes on each controller node)
- Load balancing w/haproxy
- RabbitMQ/MySQL supported per current TripleO standard
- Minimal configurability at this time

Change-Id: I77a6a69ed5691e3b1ba34e9ebb4d88c80019642c
Partially-implements: blueprint sahara-integration
Depends-On: I0f0a1dc2eaa57d8226bad8cfb250110296ab9614
Depends-On: Ib84cc59667616ec94e7edce2715cbd7dd944f4ae
Depends-On: I9fe321fd4284f7bfd55bd2e69dcfe623ed6f8a2a

subject: Add missing kernel module br_netfilter to openstack_hosts role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-11 20:15:05.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts/commit/45d89c2bb9fbc478eb4223516f572cf34ca1ca40', 'message': "Add missing kernel module br_netfilter to openstack_hosts role

The openstack_hosts role contains a list of several kernel
modules which are necessary for the successful deployment of lxc
containers.  The role also applies certain kernel parameters via
sysctl, including 3 parameters related to to the kernel module
br_netfilter.  These parameters are:

- { key: 'net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-ip6tables', value: 0 }
- { key: 'net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-iptables', value: 0 }
- { key: 'net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-arptables', value: 0 }

The list of modules and parameters can be found in the file
openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts/defaults/main.yml

A kernel change committed in version 3.17 disabled the module
br_netfilter from being loaded automatically.  The most recent release
of Ubuntu 14.04 LTS utilizes kernel version 3.19.  This results in
the aforementioned parameters failing to apply successfully, as well
as sysctl failing to properly parse /etc/sysctl.conf.

As a result, the task 'Adding new system tuning' fails.

This change adds br_netfilter to the variable
openstack_host_kernel_modules in
openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts/defaults/main.yml to correct the bug
introduced by a change in kernel behavior upstream.

This change will allow the module br_netfilter to be loaded via
modprobe, as well as inserted into /etc/modules.  This will allow the
aforementioned parameters to be applied correctly.

Change-Id: I76bfd447e0f9747679362775c44c9f84793a78f5
Closes-Bug: #1532917
"}]
commit_message:
Add missing kernel module br_netfilter to openstack_hosts role

The openstack_hosts role contains a list of several kernel
modules which are necessary for the successful deployment of lxc
containers.  The role also applies certain kernel parameters via
sysctl, including 3 parameters related to to the kernel module
br_netfilter.  These parameters are:

- { key: 'net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-ip6tables', value: 0 }
- { key: 'net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-iptables', value: 0 }
- { key: 'net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-arptables', value: 0 }

The list of modules and parameters can be found in the file
openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts/defaults/main.yml

A kernel change committed in version 3.17 disabled the module
br_netfilter from being loaded automatically.  The most recent release
of Ubuntu 14.04 LTS utilizes kernel version 3.19.  This results in
the aforementioned parameters failing to apply successfully, as well
as sysctl failing to properly parse /etc/sysctl.conf.

As a result, the task 'Adding new system tuning' fails.

This change adds br_netfilter to the variable
openstack_host_kernel_modules in
openstack-ansible-openstack_hosts/defaults/main.yml to correct the bug
introduced by a change in kernel behavior upstream.

This change will allow the module br_netfilter to be loaded via
modprobe, as well as inserted into /etc/modules.  This will allow the
aforementioned parameters to be applied correctly.

Change-Id: I76bfd447e0f9747679362775c44c9f84793a78f5
Closes-Bug: #1532917

added_lines: - br_netfilter

subject: Remove unwanted veth pair creation from lxc_container_create role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-07 19:21:02.000000000', 'files': ['templates/veth-cleanup.sh.j2', 'templates/container-interface.ini.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_container_create/commit/4f1eb22919805400e9384dfb00d826004283f1db', 'message': "Remove unwanted veth pair creation from lxc_container_create role

The lxc_container_create role creates containers specified via an inventory.
Multiple network interfaces can be added to a container during creation.  These
interfaces are provided by the task 'LXC host config for container networks' in
openstack-ansible-lxc_container_create/tasks/container_create.yml

The task 'LXC host config for container networks' utilizes a template file,
openstack-ansible-lxc_container_create/templates/container-interface.ini.j2
The configuration for a specified interface is created using this template.
The template currenlty offers the ability to modify the value 'lxc.network.type'
which defaults to type 'veth' if no value is supplied.

Supplying a value other than 'veth' is currently valid for this template.
However, the creation of a veth pair device is hard coded into the template
whether or not 'lxc.network.type' resolves to a value other than 'veth'

This creates two unwanted side effects:

First, a veth pair that is not being utilized by the corresponding container is
created.  We should not create a veth pair if it will not be used.

Secondly, if the value of the variable 'lxc.network.link' defined in the same
template file is something other than a bridge, the unwanted veth creation will
fail resulting in a container that will not start.

Additionally, if the corresponding veth pair is not created, then the template
openstack-ansible-lxc_container_create/templates/veth-cleanup.sh.j2 should be
modified to filter out interfaces that are not of type 'veth'.

This change implements interface type detection in the template files
veth-cleanup.sh.j2 and container-interface.ini.j2 to prevent creation of
unwanted veth interfaces and their associated cleanup.

Change-Id: I1c0a26d07e8de0ca862d21ea7b49e02ae447f83a
Closes-Bug: #1531935
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unwanted veth pair creation from lxc_container_create role

The lxc_container_create role creates containers specified via an inventory.
Multiple network interfaces can be added to a container during creation.  These
interfaces are provided by the task 'LXC host config for container networks' in
openstack-ansible-lxc_container_create/tasks/container_create.yml

The task 'LXC host config for container networks' utilizes a template file,
openstack-ansible-lxc_container_create/templates/container-interface.ini.j2
The configuration for a specified interface is created using this template.
The template currenlty offers the ability to modify the value 'lxc.network.type'
which defaults to type 'veth' if no value is supplied.

Supplying a value other than 'veth' is currently valid for this template.
However, the creation of a veth pair device is hard coded into the template
whether or not 'lxc.network.type' resolves to a value other than 'veth'

This creates two unwanted side effects:

First, a veth pair that is not being utilized by the corresponding container is
created.  We should not create a veth pair if it will not be used.

Secondly, if the value of the variable 'lxc.network.link' defined in the same
template file is something other than a bridge, the unwanted veth creation will
fail resulting in a container that will not start.

Additionally, if the corresponding veth pair is not created, then the template
openstack-ansible-lxc_container_create/templates/veth-cleanup.sh.j2 should be
modified to filter out interfaces that are not of type 'veth'.

This change implements interface type detection in the template files
veth-cleanup.sh.j2 and container-interface.ini.j2 to prevent creation of
unwanted veth interfaces and their associated cleanup.

Change-Id: I1c0a26d07e8de0ca862d21ea7b49e02ae447f83a
Closes-Bug: #1531935

commit_message:
overcloud-controller: install python-networking-odl

"python-networking-odl" include ODL (opendaylight) ML2 driver and
L3 service plug-in for working with ODL controller.

Closes-Bug: 1530057

commit_message:
Revert "Fix for HP 3rd Party CI failure"

This reverts commit 4f5b96e84c157bcf7d7fefc7f01473b23e27cf17.

The commit edited .testr.conf which caused unit tests to be skipped
altogehter, and that is obviously not the right thing to do.

Conflicts:
	tox.ini

Change-Id: I404e725f33e20f75c33bb794f326e46176d54f10

commit_message:
Update README.rst to include Python and testing instructions.

This updates the README to include missing instructions for
installing the Python module and basic information on testing.
Additionally, a link to the planning etherpad is also included.

Change-Id: I75795888bd19eb8116d86ee9647a2eeb6f3119be
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/stackviz refs/changes/62/265962/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ======== StackViz ========Installation - Frontend =======================Installation - Processing ========================= The data processor is a small Python module located in the same source tree. To install, run:: sudo pip install . During :code:`gulp dev`, files written to :code:`app/data/` will be automatically synchronized with the browser. Note that these files will *not* be copied to :code:`build/` during :code:`gulp prod`, but you can copy them manually using :code:`gulp data`.Data should be written to :code:`build/data/` using :code:`stackviz-export` like above. Note that the static production code generated above is portable, and can be generated anywhere and copied to another host to be combined with exported data. Testing* Python tests: :code:`tox -epy27` * JavaScript unit tests: :code:`gulp unit` * JavaScript E2E tests: :code:`gulp e2e` Roadmap and Planning ==================== - Planning: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/stackviz - Gate integration planning: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/BKgWlKIjgQ
deleted_lines: ================= StackViz: Angular =================Installation ============Roadmap- Project split: All server-side components will be removed, and replaced with specialized data transformation tools. - Data sources and processing: `stackviz` Python project, with `stackviz-export` used to generate JSON data files and configuration. - Web interface: - Will remain in this namespace (:code:`openstack-qa/stackviz`). - Will decouple data processing from build process, allowing for distribution to nodes as a prebuilt static site. - Data sources will be configured in a :code:`config.json`. - Will support local and remote sources via REST/JSONP (pending API spec). - Upstream Implementation: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/BKgWlKIjgQ

commit_message:
Fix Tosca Parser returns an exception in the output when run on a node
    type template

    tosca-parser now supports for any template or definition file that's under
    custom_types dir or nested at same level.

    Closes-Bug: #1524459

Change-Id: Ic32e524b7c4fa9f7b85a57b5552299d34f2ecf2f

commit_message:
Group everything under "assets" again

This commit groups all the assets in the json under the key "assets"
as it traditionally did. A recent change to exclude any assets marked
as inactive caused the issue.

Change-Id: I3511fa3f9e07a7f4d7358f53aae54d65ebc1b432
Closes-Bug: 1533109
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/app-catalog refs/changes/55/266455/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: y = {'assets': y}

commit_message:
Rename deploy_timeout to build_timeout

I submitted a patch referencing the 'deploy_timeout' tempest
config option for baremetal testing (see review 258079). While
in review, this timeout was renamed to 'build_timeout'. This
patch fixes the naming issue.

Related-Bug: #1526863
Change-Id: Iba21330974b3c25a85f9849ce01d52f410a0ee1f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/70/264870/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $TEMPEST_CONFIG baremetal build_timeout $BUILD_TIMEOUT

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-08 15:51:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/14c30a1bc13ab6950ea8e72d8ea8720cc1832d03', 'message': 'WIP - Allow health manager to listen on mgmt net

Change-Id: Ic3d3d1d63a5cc352c5fc00dea58bb16915754a7c
Closes-Bug: #1490033
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-01-09 06:29:02.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/8e242323719d8ed0016ff8296fe46a7feab0745c', 'message': 'Setup health manager networking for devstack

When running the health manager on single host devstack machine, the
hosts IP cannot simply be used as if the health manager is running
on a host by itself.  The solution here is to create a neutron port
on the lb-mgmt-net which sets up necessary ovs ports and also
reserves an IP.  Then the script creates an ovs port for and sets
and interface with the information the neutron port create allocated.

There are some flaws with this but its a starting point and can and
probably will be improved on in the future.  However it works for
now.

Change-Id: Ic3d3d1d63a5cc352c5fc00dea58bb16915754a7c
Closes-Bug: #1490033
'}]
commit_message:
Setup health manager networking for devstack

When running the health manager on single host devstack machine, the
hosts IP cannot simply be used as if the health manager is running
on a host by itself.  The solution here is to create a neutron port
on the lb-mgmt-net which sets up necessary ovs ports and also
reserves an IP.  Then the script creates an ovs port for and sets
and interface with the information the neutron port create allocated.

There are some flaws with this but its a starting point and can and
probably will be improved on in the future.  However it works for
now.

Change-Id: Ic3d3d1d63a5cc352c5fc00dea58bb16915754a7c
Closes-Bug: #1490033
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/22/265322/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OCTAVIA_HM_LISTEN_PORT=${OCTAVIA_HM_LISTEN_PORT:-"5555"}

commit_message:
Wrong usage of "an"

Wrong usage of "an" in the mesages:
"Add an host to the given aggregate"
"migrate an suspended server should fail"

Should be:
"Add a host to the given aggregate"
"migrate a suspended server should fail"

Totally 5 occasions in Tempest base code.

Change-Id: I010e14548a236062486e15bf9a6ee79a07313035

commit_message:
Add missing 'ext-gw-mode' extension to v1

Even though MiodNet plugin v1 supported 'ext-gw-mode', it was never
declared properly in supported extension list.

Closes-Bug:  #1485156

Change-Id: I8f9d8bd3a734d2193dc82cc38f47151c82e62a6f
(cherry picked from commit 384039be4ae7b1486f7b2a304d62c228d6c7582a)

Change assertEqual(True/False) to assertTrue/False

assertEqual(True/False, ***) should be changed to a meaningful
format of assertTrue/False(***) in test files.

commit_message:
Adds file deletion to plan manager

This patch provides the capbility to delete a file from a plan.

Change-Id: I32e2fc068dc8bdc838f8e973dfe3af1ebac917bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/66/255366/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def delete_files(self, plan_name, plan_files): """Updates files in a plan container :param plan_name: The name of the plan to use as the container name :type plan_name: str :param plan_files: The files to delete from the container. :type plan_files: list """ for filename in plan_files: try: self.plan_store.delete_file(plan_name, filename) except Exception: LOG.exception("Error deleting file from plan.") raise

commit_message:
Add os_service_default fact for tests

This change adds the os_service_default for tests as they are currently
failing due to a pick() failing because os_service_default is not
defined as a fact.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-12 13:34:49.000000000', 'files': ['docs/develop/nailgun/development/env.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/c33fd92eeb370d065aa5ec6b1d9e70c774d4cb27', 'message': 'Fuel Development Documentation fixed according of using python 2.7

Change-Id: Ie2836dd5c57af2bb59c1b7964082bc03f66e7e0d
'}]
commit_message:
Fuel Development Documentation fixed according of using python 2.7

Change-Id: Ie2836dd5c57af2bb59c1b7964082bc03f66e7e0d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/71/266371/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. warning:: Nailgun requires Python 2.7. Please check installed Python version using ``python --version``. when dealing with environment settings and package installation: mkvirtualenv fuel # you can use any name instead of 'fuel'
deleted_lines: .. warning:: Nailgun requires Python 2.6 with development files. Please check installed Python version using ``python --version``. If the version check does not match, please install Python 2.6 as described in step 1. If Python version matches, skip step 1. Please note that these instructions were tested on Ubuntu 12.04.4/14.04.1 (64 bit) that contains Python 2.7 and requires downgrade to Python 2.6. PPA instructions listed below install Python 2.6 but do not remove Python 2.7. The default Python version remains 2.7. You will have to specify Python version when you create virtual environment (see 8.1.1.1. step 5). #. Install Python 2.6 using `PPA <https://launchpad.net/~fkrull/+archive/ubuntu/deadsnakes>`:: sudo add-apt-repository --yes ppa:fkrull/deadsnakes sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install --yes python2.6 python2.6-dev when dealing with environment settings and package installation. This step is obligatory if you need to downgrade to Python version 2.6 (that Nailgun depends on):: whereis python2.6 # Prints the intall path of python 2.6, let's say /usr/bin/python2.6. # Copy the output and paste it in the command below for option -p mkvirtualenv fuel -p /usr/bin/python2.6 # you can use any name instead of 'fuel' python --version # verify that default Python version inside virtual environment is 2.6

commit_message:
OSprofiler cross service & project profiling

Change-Id: I95dccdc9f274661767d2659c18b96da169891f30
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/25/103825/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =============================== Enable cross service profiling =============================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo/+spec/enable-cross-service-profiling Problem description =================== OpenStack consists of multiple projects. Each project, in turn, has multiple services. To process some request, e.g. to boot a virtual machine, OpenStack uses multiple services from different projects. In case something works too slowly, it's extremely complicated to understand what exactly goes wrong and to locate the bottleneck. To resolve this issue, we introduce a tiny but powerful library, **osprofiler**, that is going to be used by all OpenStack projects and their python clients. This library generates 1 trace per request, that goes through all services involved, and builds a tree of calls (see an `example <http://pavlovic.me/rally/profiler/>`_). *osprofiler* maintains a trace stack (list of trace elements ids). It's stored in thread-safe global variable. First element of this list is called base_id - and it's used to be able to retrieve all trace elements related to one single trace. Every time when we are doing: profiler.init(base_id, trace_id) we will flush this stack and fill it with 2 values [base_id, trace_id] Every time when we are calling profiler.start() we are adding new trace_id to end of list (top of stack). Every time when we are calling profiler.stop() we will pop last value. So this allows us to keep information about nested calls of profiler in simple way. Operation profiler.start() and profiler.stop() actually calls specially notify() method with information about trace element. It sends: (trace_base_id, trace_parent_id, trace_current_id, and any meta info). This notify() method can have different implementation. And we decide to make first implementation based on Notifier API and Ceilometer as a collector of notifications (it's simplest way to get this done). In scope of one service this actually already works (because Ceilometer plugin for collecting notifications was already merged). But when we are speaking about cross service profiling it doesn't work. Cause instances of profiler are different in different services, so we should be able to "sync" profiler instances between caller and callee. Actually for synchronization it's enough to send base_id and current_trace_id (that will be setted in callee profiler as a parent_id). Proposed change =============== * (caller side) Add trace info to message, before sending message: {"base_id": <uuid>, "trace_id": <uuid>, "hmac": <key>} * (callee side) Init profiler with this trace info * (callee side) Create one trace point profiler.start()/profiler.stop() this allows us to do 2 things: ** Measure duration of RPC method ** Collect all trace points related to this RPC calls under one root. Proposed change is implemented in patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/103271/ Alternatives ------------ To be honest, I didn't find any another simple solution, that won't contain ton of code and be hard to integrate in all projects. Impact on Existing APIs ----------------------- None. It is internal change of oslo.messaging. So we are adding extra info in rpc message, that is removed before we are processing it on callee side. Security impact --------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ * If it is not activated there is NO performance overhead. (just couple of "if None" checks) * If it is activated, there is a performance impact equal to: ** push and pop <uuid> to short list I don't believe that there will be more then 20 elements in very worst case ** couple of "if not None" checks ** push and pop 2 <uuid> and HMAC key to message that is send to callee ** sending 2 osprofiler.notifications with quite short meta info. (Depends on driver that we are using for osprofiler.notifications, so in base implementation it will be 2 oslo.messaging.notifier notifications) Configuration Impact -------------------- None. There is non configuration options for it. It is turned lazy on always. This code will be activated only in one situation: If service uses OSprofiler and called profiler.init(), before doing rpc call. Developer Impact ---------------- Developers will be able to profile OpenStack and fix different issues related to performance and scale. There is no issues related to integration it in other projects. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: boris-42 Milestones ---------- Juno-3 Work Items ---------- * Get in already existing patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/103271/ Incubation ========== None. Adoption -------- None. Library ------- None. Anticipated API Stabilization ----------------------------- None. Required only one release to get this code in latest version of lib. As well there will be no issues with migrating to new version of oslo.messaging because this change is fully transparent for all services that would like to use it. Documentation Impact ==================== None. The trace instances between services are transparently synced for end services that are using oslo.messaging and OSprofiler. E.g. it just works without any changes in service that would like to be able to use cross service profiling. Dependencies ============ - OSprofiler is optional dependency for oslo.messaging. If service would like to use OSprofiler and installs it oslo.messaging will do all stuff about syncing profiler state between services. Otherwise code related to OSprofiler will be just ignored. References ========== * Implementation: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/103271/ * OSprofiler lib: https://github.com/stackforge/osprofiler * Ceilometer notification plugin: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/100239/ .. note:: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode

commit_message:
Use the oslo.utils.reflection to extract the class name

The oslo.utils reflection module/code handles more variations
 of where a class name may come from (on python 2 and python 3)
so its usage allows getting more accurate class names so we might
as well use it.

Change-Id: I631768c0691843880baacff4d0a74deea8077c04
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-manilaclient refs/changes/16/265116/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import reflection self_cls_name = reflection.get_class_name(self, fully_qualified=False) return "<%s %s>" % (self_cls_name, info)

commit_message:
LBaaS: Store Private Key Passphrase for TLS

Change-Id: I5a3681b255046c1f49fbf1bd927503a45840a0ea
Related-Bug: 1508243
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/07/237807/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================================== Store Private Key Passphrase in Neutron-LBaaS for TLS Terminations ================================================================== https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1508243 The current workflow for TLS Termination on loadbalancers has a couple of interesting security vulnerabilities that need to be addressed somehow. The solution I propose is to encourage the use of passphrase encryption on private keys, and to store that passphrase in Neutron-LBaaS along with the Barbican href, instead of inside Barbican. I will describe the specific vulnerabilities and how this solves them in "Problem Description" below. Problem Description =================== First, a description of our current workflow: 1. Alice creates secrets in Barbican for her Certificate and Private Key. 2. Alice creates a CertificateContainer with links to those secrets. 3. Alice sets ACLs in Barbican for that container and its secrets, granting read access to the Neutron-LBaaS service account. 4. Alice creates a loadbalancer in Neutron-LBaaS, including the Barbican container ref she got from step 1. 5. Neutron-LBaaS connects to Barbican to retrieve the secrets using its own service account, which is granted access due to the ACLs from step 3. 6. Neutron-LBaaS passes control to the implementation specific driver, which either reads the secrets from Barbican again and passes the data to its backend system, or just passes on the ref, depending on the implementation. There are two specific cases where our current workflow is vulnerable. Scenario 1: Compromised Barbican HREF ------------------------------------- 1. Eve somehow finds out the ref for Alice's CertificateContainer (this is not likely to happen, but it could -- the refs are not technically considered "secret" data in the same way their payloads are). 2. Eve creates a loadbalancer in Neutron-LBaaS, including the Barbican container ref she got from step 1 (this is a mirror of Alice's step 4). 3. Neutron-LBaaS performs the same actions as steps 5/6 above, which succeed because its service account already has ACL access to the secrets due to Alice performing step 3 (adding ACLs, for her own loadbalancer's use). Scenario 2: Compromised Operator / User Account ------------------------------------------------ 1. Some account is compromised, either via a user's API Key leaking, or any other of a myriad of possibilities. This could be Alice's account, or the account of an operator or identity admin (both are fairly severe examples, but not impossible). 2. Eve uses the account to get Alice's loadbalancer configuration, which returns the Barbican ref for her CertificateContainer. 3. Eve uses the account to retrieve Alice's private key from Barbican. Proposed Change =============== Both scenarios end with Alice's private key compromised in a way that can be exploited. Scenario 1 is probably more likely, but I believe neither should be discounted as possibilities. The change I propose requires the user to encrypt their private key with a passphrase (hopefully common practice) and to submit that passphrase along with the Barbican container ref to Neutron-LBaaS (*not* storing it in the same container as the key in Barbican, even though there is a named field for it). The passphrase should not be retrievable from Neutron-LBaaS -- it should be stored, but not be part of any API response about the loadbalancer config. This has the advantage of splitting the information required to use the key into two distinct systems. While it is not foolproof (there are surely ways in which both systems could be compromised in the same attack) it is much more secure than the alternative (keeping all information in a single system). Both of the scenarios above are mitigated, because when Neutron-LBaaS retrieves the key from Barbican, it is unable to decrypt it (since Eve should not also know the passphrase). In this case Neutron-LBaaS will put the loadbalancer in ERROR status, as the TLS information is not retrievable. The passphrase should probably be stored encrypted in a standard way (specific method should possibly be discussed and documented here in a future draft). Updates would need to be made to the model layer and the API layer to accomidate taking in and storing this data in the same table as the current TLS container ref. Alternatives ------------ Scenario 1 could be mitigated by doing a strict check of the tenant_id of the secret matching the tenant_id of the loadbalancer being created, but this would also block a use-case that I believe should be considered valid: 1. Alice creates secrets in her account for use with her company's products. 2. Alice grants ACL access to her secrets to her co-worker Bob. 3. Bob uses Alice's CertificateContainer refs to create loadbalancers for his own deployments. Other solutions can be proposed, but I can't think of any that are effective. Data Model Impact ----------------- There will be one additional field stored in the tls data table. REST API Impact --------------- There will be one additional (optional?) field in the API call to create or update a TLS Termination. Security Impact --------------- This protects against several possible vulnerabilities that could cause a user's private key to be compromised. Other End User Impact --------------------- The end user will now need to track both their CertificateContainer references (which are available as a list via a Barbican GET call) and also a passphrase for the private keys in those containers. This is somewhat more effort than storing all of that data together in Barbican, and could be perceived to be a burden (though to the security conscious, the benefits should hopefully be obvious). It is because of this burden that my proposal is for passphrase encryption of keys to be optional (though this comes at the expense of having the user be possibly vulnerable if they skip this optional step). References ========== None

commit_message:
Set --serial as default in run-tempest.sh

Currently this is set in gate-check-commit, but this is a sensible
default for situations other than gate-check-commit so it should be set
in run-tempest itself.

Change-Id: I0bef1c5650757d54dd4fbeb6b872bd00cabed627
Closes-bug: #1530796
(cherry picked from commit 850221910e780f6d0b3d790b377992ca6b329456)

commit_message:
Fix incorrect default metadata_dir and api_url parameters

According to murano-dashboard package murano::dashboard points
to incorrect metadata_dir by default.

Also, since Murano dashboard can use Keystone to locate Murano API,
murano::dashboard parameter api_url should not be set by default.

Change-Id: I9e121b6097afe471ad2914b1fc02624b3b36c1ca
Closes-Bug: #1518981

commit_message:
Add apache mod_proxy for ceph radosgw

With the switch to fcgi for radosgw we need to include mod_proxy as
mod_proxy_fcgi requires it. This change pulls in the proxy module to
resolve apache2 startup failures when ceph is enabled.

Change-Id: I7044b58066e70b11ed9358579a2f369ce761ee06
Related-Bug: #1521623
Related-Bug: #1505273
Closes-Bug: #1532860
(cherry picked from commit a2d391a76082c7b00740b11a36e698006f185808)

commit_message:
objects: adding a parent_addr field to the PciDevice object

The parent_addr field will help identify the relationship between
Physical and Virtual pci device functions.

This information was already available to the PciDevice objects and was
stored in extra_info['phys_function'] field, so we add code that will
migrate old data on the fly, for live upgrade scenarios where we still
have running older compute nodes alongside new ones.

We don't want to migrate, however, if there are still any API service
instances running that might access this info directly (without the help
of the conductor) but have not been upgraded yet.

Co-authored-by: Nikola Đipanov <ndipanov@redhat.com>
Partially implements blueprint sriov-physical-function-passthrough
Change-Id: I94e8ce2c2a3d1c9e8b4aa1b245076eba84f37f45

commit_message:
Use assertTrue/False instead of assertEqual(T/F)

The usage of assertEqual(True/False, ***) should be changed
to a meaningful format of assertTrue/False(***).

Closes-Bug: #1512207
Change-Id: I2e3466efce9f7333335d901e6c3342454b163cbf

commit_message:
Do not manage network, subnet, router resources if prefetch fails

If prefetch of neutron_network, neutron_subnet, or neutron_router
resources fails (because of Neutron API timeouts or failures, for
example) then the provider will believe the resources don't exist
and will attempt to create them.  This can cause duplicate
resources in Neutron.

This patch records when the prefetch fails, and if so, shunts
any of the resource management methods to fail().

Change-Id: I612847bfd23ac735583ab228d8a9396f52f0ef14
Closes-bug: 1532284

commit_message:
Rename admin_state_up method to avoid conflict with accessor

The admin_state_up(value) method conflicts with the accessor method
for the admin_state_up resource parameter.  This patch renames
it to set_admin_state_up(value) to avoid this conflict.

Change-Id: I5a1e23c1541d7ed815ea37f1972abc345e2ba984
Closes-bug: 1532282

commit_message:
fix stable/liberty telemetry integration job

devstack-gate sets up the environment for gate jobs but it
configures branches at a global level rather than a per project
level. this means projects which are released independently can't
be tested with other projects.

ok, this has to work. this uses OVERRIDE_$PROJECT_PROJECT_BRANCH
variable[1] to override gnocchi branch when devstack-gate sets up
workspace for gate.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/devstack-gate/blob/master/functions.sh#L422

Change-Id: Ieffb4184cd7bc47e7d71434175f75a5be07bd112
Closes-Bug: #1526530

commit_message:
Use _get_client in make_client helper function

We have a capability to know what constructor is needed for make_client,
but we didn't plumb it in. Make sure that the only thing needed is:

  os_client_config.make_client('compute')

Change-Id: I02aa1c46fa7cdfdb1409f8e1232e364b5ba48cd2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config refs/changes/93/265493/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from os_client_config import cloud_configdef make_client(service_key, constructor=None, options=None, **kwargs): if not constructor: constructor = cloud_config._get_client(service_key) cloud = config.get_one_cloud(options=parsed_options, **kwargs) return cloud.get_legacy_client(service_key, constructor)
deleted_lines: def make_client(service_key, constructor, options=None, **kwargs): cloud_config = config.get_one_cloud(options=parsed_options, **kwargs) return cloud_config.get_legacy_client(service_key, constructor)

commit_message:
Add barbicanclient support

barbicanclient is a lovely client library, so we should add support
for make_legacy_client to doing the right things constructing a Client
object.

Change-Id: Idf015b1119ef76b951c195a6498cbb7a928d6e44

commit_message:
Update auth urls and identity API versions

Most of the clouds, it turns out, support unversioned auth_url as well
as keystone v3.

Change-Id: I088d008cd2732f137c8a1bbbd9c0a43f7d382f92
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config refs/changes/03/264203/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "auth_url": "https://compute.datacentred.io:5000" "identity_api_version": "2",

commit_message:
Create glance::cache::logging class

This review creates the glance::cache::logging class to be in feature
parity with glance::api and glance::registry.

Change-Id: Ia3f27e991b1e525ee3604502d6afc6dc7d45247c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance refs/changes/96/238096/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: include ::glance::cache::logging
deleted_lines: 'DEFAULT/verbose': value => pick($verbose, false); 'DEFAULT/debug': value => pick($debug, false);

commit_message:
Explicitly depend on WebTest>=2.0

pecan depends on WebTest 1.3.1, but we use JSON features from 2.0.

Closes-Bug: #1524816
Change-Id: I9b99c686cddc4a916c39359d5a1006ed4c1ddef0
(cherry picked from commit 40f9238275e12d2d9bad97c20147dd451f841125)

commit_message:
Fix params order in assertEqual

Fix params oeder to correspond to real signature:
    assertEqual(expected, actual)

Change-Id: Iad65accc86a2d1f7df7284596e1bbceeb091d39e
Closes-Bug: #1277104
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/94/266194/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertEqual("<Resource baz=spam, foo=bar>", repr(r)) self.assertEqual("4", base.getid(TmpObject(None, {}))) self.assertEqual("1", r.human_id) self.assertEqual({'id': 42}, result)
